prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Bikini
Description: A hearty, motherly nun at Hazakura Temple, a channeling dojo deep in the mountains.
Character 5
Name: Elise Deauxnim
Description: Kind-eyed author and illustrator of picture books. Pearls is huge fan of hers.
Character 6
Name: Iris
Description: A nun at Hazakura Temple. She reminds me so much of "her"...
Character 7
Name: Laurice Deauxnim* (when playing as Wright) → Larry Butz* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Description: Better known as Larry Butz. Current in training as Elise Deauxnim's pupil.
Character 8
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My friend since grade school. Fell from Dusky Bridge and is currently hospitalized.
Character 9
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 10
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor, Manfred von Karma's, daughter. Born/raised in Germany. Prosecutor at 13.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: An old friend. Said to be #1 at the D.A.'s office. Studies foreign judicial systems now.
Character 12
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Older sister of Misty Fey and mother of Pearl and Iris. Is in solitary confinement.
Character 13
Name: ?????? → Dahlia Hawthorne
Description: Morgan Fey's daughter and Iris's twin sister. Her father deals in jewelry apparently.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. He wasn't serious when he gave this to me... was he?* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 1
Name: Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. Something about reading people's hearts... What utter nonsense.* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 2
Name: Oh! Cult! New Year's Issue
Description: An occult magazine featuring Hazakura Temple. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Hazakura Temple Map
Description: Shows Hazakura Temple and the surrounding area. Click here for details.
Evidence 4
Name: Hanging Scroll
Description: Shows Misty Fey, Master of the Kurain Technique. Click here for details. Misty Fey's image is obscured by gravy. Click here for details.
Evidence 5
Name: Photo of Elise
Description: Taken by her only pupil, Laurice Deauxnim. She is wearing a white robe and a hood. She was holding a book and a staff. The staff has a crystal sphere attached to it.
Evidence 6
Name: Iris's Hood
Description: A hood that Iris wears at all times. A magical hood said to offer protection from evil spirits. Received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. Protects from evil spirits.
Iris:
If it's alright with you... I would like you to have this.

Phoenix:
But this is your hood...
Evidence 7
Name: Weather Data
Description: A regional weather report for the night of the crime.
Eagle Mountain Weather Data for Feb. 07
Snow, with occasional lightning strikes.

Snow: 7 to approx. 10:50 PM
Lightning: 10 to approx. 11 PM

Lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45.
Around 30 minutes passed between
the fire starting and going out.
Evidence 8
Name: Note to Iris
Description: Found in the Main Hall. Maybe she dropped it? Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Victim's Staff
Description: Carried by Elise Deauxnim when she was alive. Has her fingerprints on it. There is no crystal sphere attached. Has a sword hidden inside. No one knows this except Detective Gumshoe and I. Has a sword hidden inside. The actual weapon used to murder the victim.
Evidence 10
Name: Shichishito
Description: The apparent murder weapon. A seven-branched, jagged sword. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon.
Evidence 11
Name: Elise's Autopsy Report
Description: Time: 10 - 11 PM. Cause: loss of blood from stab in back. Body fell 10 ft. after death.
Evidence 12
Name: Iris's Testimony
Description: Rang lights out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered.
Evidence 13
Name: Crime Photo
Description: The courtyard where Elise Deauxnim was murdered. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: Tracks Photo
Description: Taken that night. [caption] One track is shown leading from Main Gate to Dusky Bridge.
Evidence 15
Name: Larry's Sketch
Description: Horrible sketch of what he saw the night of the crime. Click here for details.
Evidence 16
Name: Crystal Sphere
Description: Found half-covered in snow near Dusky Bridge the night of the crime. Has blood on it. Found on outcropping near Dusky Bridge. Has blood on it. Came from the victim's staff.
Evidence 17
Name: Kurain Master's Talisman
Description: Worn by Elise Deauxnim. Found in the garden of the Inner Temple.
Evidence 18
Name: Burnt Letter
Description: Found by Gumshoe in the Inner Temple incinerator. Click here for details. Orders from Morgan Fey. Opened once before. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Dagger
Description: Found behind a tree in the Inner Temple garden. The blood is being analyzed now. Found stuck in a pine tree in Inner Temple Garden. The blood doesn't match the victim's.
Evidence 20
Name: Stone Lantern
Description: A lantern from the Inner Temple garden. Was not lit the night of the crime.
Evidence 21
Name: Dusky Bridge Photo
Description: Taken the morning after the crime. Click here for details.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: That night I was helping an acolyte with her training in the Inner Temple. But...
Person: Bikini
Testimony 1
Testimony: Well, as you can see, my back likes to act up. Violently.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 2
Testimony: So, I left Iris to help the acolyte, and returned to Hazakura Temple.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 3
Testimony: Iris came to the Inner Temple. She was dressed exactly as she had been at dinner.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 4
Testimony: There's no bath at the Inner Temple, you see, and I needed a long, hot soak.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 5
Testimony: It was after I had finished, just as I was heading back... that's when I saw it!
Person: Bikini

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
To find a contradiction, let's examine both the evidence and testimonies closely, particularly looking for conflicting information.

**Bikini's Testimony 3:** "Iris came to the Inner Temple. She was dressed exactly as she had been at dinner."

**Evidence 6 - Iris's Hood:** This evidence notes that the hood was given to Phoenix Wright before the lights-out bell rang the night of the crime. Thus, Iris was not wearing it then.

If Iris gave her hood to someone else, she could not have been dressed "exactly as she had been at dinner," as she wouldn't have her hood on. Therefore, the testimony that mentioned Iris coming in fully dressed as she was at dinner contradicts the evidence where Iris gives her hood to someone during that timeframe.

cot: The "Victim's Staff" (Evidence 9) contains a crucial detail which contradicts "Bikini's Testimony 2" (Testimony 2). The evidence description states that the staff has a sword hidden inside it, which implicates the staff as the murder weapon. However, Bikini testified that the sword was used to murder "Mystic Elise." Bikini's testimony suggests seeing Iris wielding a sword openly and contradicts the information that the murder weapon was a concealed sword and not an openly wielded one.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: When I looked across at the scene, the sword was already in place.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 1
Testimony: Thinking about it now, I didn't actually see her stab Mystic Elise.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 2
Testimony: I saw the instant in which the blade, plunged in to the hilt, was smoothly drawn out.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 3
Testimony: I've never seen so much blood before...
Person: Bikini
Testimony 4
Testimony: That's when I fainted. You can't blame me, can you?
Person: Bikini
Testimony 5
Testimony: And when I awoke... Mystic Ami was... stabbing Mystic Elise through the back!
Person: Bikini

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Testimony 5 from Bikini claims that "Mystic Ami was... stabbing Mystic Elise through the back." However, Elise Deauxnim was actually stabbed with the Victim's Staff (Evidence 9), the sword hidden inside. Additionally, Evidence 9 states that she was already dead when she fell 10 feet after being stabbed. Thus, it is impossible for Elise to be seen being stabbed through the back after the fact by someone known as "Mystic Ami." 

Bikini's testimony is highly suspicious as it implies a stabbing was witnessed when the true murder weapon was hidden and involved a fall. Another point of contradiction is between Bikini's assertion and the implication of her statement that suggests there was another person present as "Mystic Ami," which adds inconsistency given that the victim had already been slain by the hidden weapon.

cot:
To find contradictions between the evidence and testimony, let's first analyze Testimony 3 by Bikini, which states: "It takes 15 minutes to walk to Dusky Bridge, but less than 5 using one of those!", referring to a snowmobile.

Evidence 14, Tracks Photo, is the only piece that links the snowmobile use to the crime scene. However, the contradiction arises when considering that the testimony implies quick travel to and from Dusky Bridge, whereas Evidence 14 indicates that only one track was shown leading from Main Gate to Dusky Bridge, suggesting someone traveled one way rather than making a round trip or returning.

Thus, the contradiction lies in the fact that the testimony suggests both outgoing and return trips, whereas the evidence photo indicates travel in only a single direction.

Testimony 0

Person: Butz

Person: Butz

Testimony: There was still some thunder, but I went right away to check it out.
Person: Butz

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
To find a contradiction, we'll focus on the timeline and details given in both evidence and testimonies.

- The Weather Data (Evidence 7) indicates that lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45 PM.
- Larry Butz's testimonies (Testimonies 0-6) provide his timeline and actions during the event.

Let's examine Testimony 3:
Testimony 3 says that Butz mentioned going to check out Dusky Bridge when there was still some thunder. Given that the thunder/lightning lasted from 10 to approximately 11 PM, Butz could indeed have seen thunder or lightning. However, what strikes as important is the timeline of these events:

Since lightning struck at precisely 10:45 PM at Dusky Bridge and Butz was to see Dusky Bridge afterward, this would have likely been very soon after the lightning strike. Butz’s Testimony 1 states that a white flash nearly blinded him, suggesting proximity to the time of the lightning strike at 10:45 PM. Butz's timeline from Testimonies 0 and 1 places him at the shack after 9 PM, backing the visibility of the lightning.

Now let's look at Testimony 5:
Testimony 5 mentions that Butz arrived at the bridge and Phoenix Wright showed up less than a minute later. Here we find a discrepancy—it's directly tied to the fire that Butz claims to see ("I looked out the window... and Dusky Bridge was on fire!"), indirectly contradicting the Evidence 7 weather report which claimed the fire started due to a lightning strike at 10:45 PM, conflicting with Butz's testimonial timeline. Butz claims to have seen the bridge on fire or was headed to it when it was set ablaze—yet, his timeline shows he saw lightning and the bridge presumably being on fire simultaneously, causing overlap in perceived timeframes which creates a contradiction in his urgency and proximity compared to the lighting's actual role at 10:45 PM.

Thus, we can see a contradiction between Butz's Testimony 5 (arrival and the bridge situation timing), mixed with the Weather Data suggesting the fire started and timeline stats showing a clash in the said event portrayal. We take this stance for contradictions more in the timing discrepancy than direct quotes;

The deeper timeline and context understanding provide enough grounds for an evidential conflict as recorded in opposed testimony.

Finally, the contradiction between Butz's actions (Testimony 5) and the regional weather report (Evidence 7), showing timeframe discrepancy, requires fine presentation:

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot: The testimony given by Butz (Laurice Deauxnim) about seeing "Iris flying! Her white hood fluttering!" (Testimony 2) contradicts Evidence 6, Iris's Hood. She gave her hood to Phoenix before the lights-out bell the night of the crime, so she could not have been wearing it, meaning nobody should have been able to see "Iris flying" with a "white hood fluttering."
